news.headline: Driverless 18-wheelers may reach your street sooner than you think
news.summary: Opening Bid Unfiltered is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. The driverless car race is well underway. While Waymo is seen as having a leadership position, Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk is aiming for robotaxi debuts likely in 2026. Thus far, the race to bring autonomous trucks to life to address driver shortages is a bit more open. Aurora Innovation (AUR) is seen as the leader at this juncture and is backed by Uber (UBER), boasting key partnerships with Paccar (PCAR), Nvidia (NVDA), and Volvo (VOLCAR-B.ST). The company has successfully debuted driverless commercial trucks on select routes in Texas, with plans to expand to more routes in 2026. Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi talks on the Opening Bid Unfiltered podcast with Aurora Innovation co-founder and Chris Urmson. Urmson led Google's (GOOG) driverless technology unit for several years, which ultimately became Waymo. He shares his vision for Aurora Innovation, the 2026 product roadmap, and why autonomous technology is needed for commercial trucks. Listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website for full episodes of Opening Bid Unfiltered. Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid Unfiltered is produced by Langston Sessoms.

news.headline: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit
news.summary: STORY: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion.The deal would give control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.It follows a weeks-long bidding war in which Netflix offered nearly $28-a-share.That beat Paramount Skydance's close to $24 bid for the whole of Warner Bros Discovery, including the cable TV assets slated for a spinoff.Buying the owner of franchises including "Harry Potter", "Game of Thrones" and "DC Comics" will further push the balance of power in Hollywood in favor of Netflix.And help the streaming giant as it competes with Walt Disney and the Ellison family-led Paramount.The deal is likely to face strong antitrust scrutiny in Europe and the U.S. though.As it would give the world's biggest streaming service ownership of a rival that is home to HBO Max and has nearly 130 million streaming subscribers.Paramount kicked off the bidding war with a series of unsolicited offers.It has close ties with the Trump administration.It questioned the sale process earlier this week and alleged favorable treatment to Netflix.Even before the bids were in, some members of Congress said a Netflix–Warner Bros Discovery deal could harm consumers and Hollywood.

news.headline: The Week in Numbers: Thanksgiving sales surge, Disney's China record
news.summary: STORY: From a Thanksgiving holiday sales surge to a Disney film breaking Chinese records...This is the Week in Numbers.:: Week in Numbers:: $44 billion$44 billion was how much U.S. shoppers spent online over the Thanksgiving weekend.Consumers bought up during the five-days from Thanksgiving to Cyber Monday as retail giants like Amazon and Walmart rolled out discounts.The data came from an Adobe Analytics report.It showed spending was up 7.7% from a year earlier and beat Adobe's forecast.:: 10% 10% is how much Boeing shares jumped after a positive report.Investors bought in after the planemaker said it expects higher jet deliveries and positive free cash flow next year.Boeing wants to improve its image after a 5-year corporate crisis involving safety and production issues of its 737 series.The issues have hit its reputation and sent the U.S. major deeply into debt:: $1.5 billion$1.5 billion is how much Prada spent to buy out fellow Italian fashion brand Versace.Prada had long sought the deal and signed an agreement in April to purchase the decades-old firm from U.S.-based Capri Holdings.The late Gianni Versace founded his luxury brand known for its glamorous style in 1978.His sister Donatella stepped down as creative head earlier this year.:: 10.6%10.6% was the sales growth rise for Zara owner Inditex in November.It's a crucial period for retailers due to the Black Friday weekend.It also confirmed a strong start to the fashion major's biggest revenue quarter.One analyst said the Spanish company may have its home market to thank due to the country's strong economy.:: $275.6 millionAnd $275.6 million was how much Disney's Zootopia 2 made in its first six days of release in China.That means it has become the highest-grossing animated foreign film ever in the country.Zootopia 2 made up around 95% of all movie ticket sales over its opening weekend.It comes just months after Beijing cut the number of U.S. films allowed in China due to its trade war with Washington.

news.headline: Amazon and Google launch multicloud service for faster connectivity
news.summary: Amazon and Google introduced a jointly developed multicloud networking service on Sunday to meet growing demand for ​reliable connectivity the companies said in a statement, at a time when ‌even brief internet disruptions can cause major outages.  The new service is being unveiled a little over a month after an Amazon Web Services outage on October 20 disrupted thousands of websites worldwide, knocking offline some of the internet's most popular ⁠apps, including Snapchat and ‌Reddit.  The new offering combines AWS' Interconnect–multicloud with Google Cloud's Cross-Cloud Interconnect, to improve network interoperability, according to announcements by the two cloud providers.
